author: wsjcom
title: Holding the FBI Accountable for Its Actions
text: Regarding your editorial “A Reckoning for the FBI” (Feb. 3): Poor Carter Page, who had been monitored by the FBI for being a probable Russian agent at least since 2013. Didn’t the FBI have good reason to surveil him, notwithstanding his U.S. citizenship? Here we have no minor volunteer, as the editorial avers, but someone touted initially by Donald Trump himself as an important foreign-policy adviser, and yet he emerged as a suspected Russian spy. Requests to renew FISA warrants have to be accompanied by evidence that the initial warrant has borne fruit. The FBI obtained three renewals. FISA warrant applications aren’t...
